metadata.title: CVE-2022-3623 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been declared asproblematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function follow_page_pteof the file mm/gup.c of the component BPF. The manipulation leads to racecondition. The attack can be launched remotely. It is recommended to applya patch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-211921 was assigned to thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
